Arkansas politicians have launched an all-out assault on abortion access.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Earlier this month, we asked you to be on high alert for Arkansas legislators trying to punish women and push abortion care out of reach.

Now we need your voice to tell Arkansas senators to oppose abortion bans and protect women's health.

Arkansas senators have introduced three harmful bills that would ban or severely restrict abortion access in Arkansas – and they could come up for a vote any day. Here's what you need to know about the latest assault on reproductive rights:

  • Interrogating Women About Their Motives (SB 2): Senate Bill 2 is an unconstitutional abortion ban that would criminalize abortion when the woman's reason for the abortion is a fetal diagnosis of Down syndrome. This would turn women into suspects and doctors into interrogators.
  • Banning Abortion if Roe v. Wade Is Overturned (SB 149): Senate Bill 149 is a so-called "trigger law" that would ban abortion automatically if Roe v. Wade is overturned.
  • Unnecessary Reporting Requirements for Doctors (SB 3): Senate Bill 3 is a medically unnecessary restriction meant to punish abortion providers, while doing nothing to improve patient care or safety.

Once a woman has decided to end a pregnancy, it is not the place of politicians to shame or punish her for that decision, or push care out of reach.

But that's not stopping some Arkansas officials from barging into the exam room with outlandish demands and cruel restrictions.

Contact your senator and tell them to protect women's health and oppose these unconstitutional restrictions.

Don't know who your senator is? Enter your address and city to find out.

Remember, these elected officials work for you – and it's up to all of us to make our voices heard.

ACLU of Arkansas
